But I must close this. I wish to say that I am never troubled with an offensive breath or a bad taste in my mouth. I relish my food. I enjoy apples very much, but good apples are not to be obtained here as in America. A few barrels of Northern Spys, such as we used to have in America, would be a treat. But we cannot procure these here.--Letter 82, 1897. 







Ellen G. White Estate 
Silver Spring, Maryland 
February 28, 1991. Entire Letter.
